FacilityName: Progressive Ag Coop formerly FCC - Manly

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION/EMERGENCY RESPONSE AT PROGRESSIVE AG COOPERATIVE ELEVATOR, MANLY, IA.

This facility complies with ANSI Standrd K-61.1-1989 requirements for Anhydrous Ammonia storage with amendments.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and local regulations.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to immediately notify the Manly Volunteer Fire Department (via 911 call) and request that it respond to the emergency.  Incidental to the notification to the fire department, a call to the Worth County, IA LEPC will be made.

While we have planned for an emergency, it is acknowleded that a real emergency will be unexpected and may very well be much different and cannot be ensured to duplicate what nmay have been planned,.  In reality, the situation that develops may not happen in the manner in which it has been planned.  In that event, what may have been planned will serve only as a guideline to follow.

The Emergency Action Plan for this facility describes certain procedures that are intended to minimize the hazards associated with human health and the environment from fires, explosions, the sudden and unexpected release of chemicals (i.e., Anhydrous Ammonia), tornadoes, bomb threats, or other accident or acts of God which might occur on our premises.

The primanyu emergency coordinator for the Progressive Ag Cooperative Elevator is Brad Foster, Operations Manager.  His work and 24-hour emergency reponse telephone numbers are provided in the Registration Section of this document.  In addition, the followingn individuals (with associated work and 24-hour emergency response telephone numbers) are to be contacted in order:


Brad Foster, Operations Manager
        WORK:  (641) 454-2282
        Cell:       (641) 420-5685

Bill Pate
         WORK:  (641) 454-2282
         Cell:       (641) 420-5550

DESCRIPTION OF THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE/DISTRIBUTION PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED AT PROGRESSIVE AG COOPERATIVE E

LEVATOR:

This facility is a bulk anhydrous ammonia storage and distribution plant.  The anhydrous ammonia that is stored at this facility is distributed to agricultural crop producers in the surrounding area who utilize the anhydrous ammonia for crop nutrient purposes

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable State and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with ANSI Standard K61.1-1989 with amendments and State law.

In addition the company has specific operating procedures in place intended to minimize the potential for an accidental (and potentially catastrophic) release of anhydrous ammonia.  Finally, Progressive Ag Cooperative Elevator has extended to the Manly Volunteer Fire Department the opportunity to visit our anhydrous ammonia plant, to participte in mock emergency simulation training and to avail themselves of specific anhydrous ammonia health hazard information and training provided by the company.

FIVE -YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Progressive Cooperative Elevator, Manly, IA  has never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is the policy of Progressive Ag Cooperative Elevator to immediately notify the Manly Volunteer Fire Department and the WorthCounty, IA LEPC to request that they respond to the emergency.  In the unlikely event that the Manly Volunteer Fire Department is unable to adequately respond to an emergency at our location, the volunteer fire department with whom Osage has a reciprocal agreement will be summoned.  We have  discussed this policy with the fire department and Worth County LEPC.  Members of the fire department and the LEPC have inspec
ted our anhydrous ammonia plant.  In addition, copies of photographs taken of our plant have been provided (for reference) to both entities.
